Name: 5 Steps to a 5 AP Physics 1 Algebra-based, 2015 Edition (5 Steps to a 5 on the Advanced Placement Examinations Series)

ReviewList.Text: Greg Jacobs is extraordinarily good at teaching all levels of physics, and this book is no exception. I am a high school physics teacher and college physics professor that has attended several of Greg Jacobs' workshops in the past, and he truly is a master physics teacher. With such limited information out there on the new AP Physics exams that are coming next May, this book is the best thing on the market.

As a new student who took Physics 1 course for the first time,  I find the content too superficial to gain the solid knowledge of each theories. I also find that the explanations are just too broad, and short. They don't show the step by step approach of how each formulas are apply,but instead just the answer with some words explanation..

Been using it for two weeks. The instruction is a bit long and wordy for me. I think the book more focuses on how to prepare for the test when you don't have enough time so it's not like a textbook but more like a study guide. If you want to self-study, don't pick this one; but if you want extra help outside the AP course, this would be the right fit for you.
I have to say that this book the best possible prep book currently on the market for the new AP physics 1 exam. The only thing disappointing is that it only includes one practice exam at the end.

I personally think this book is one of the better ones if you need to review in a fairly short period of time(a week or two before). Half the book explains simple AP test taking strategies and the test. The other half is review material and a practice test. The review is quality, but not very lengthy and has less practice problems than other review books such as Barrons.It covers pretty much everything that you'll need to know for the test. This doesn't mean that you can just read this and get a five, quite the opposite in fact. The best way to prepare for the AP test is to apply yourself throughout the class. Review helps, but the test will challenge your knowledge and  thinking skills that you acquired during the year. My biggest problem with this book isn't the low amount of practice problems but the way the practice problems are set up. The book has problems with real answers (like 200 N) while the AP Physics 1 test has more along the lines of F/4.On the test you'll probably use your calculator three or four times for the whole test. It's a very conceptual test. This book is decent, but I think it will need to be improved now that AP Physics 1 is in its second year.
Little material, badly worded questions, and answers riddled with typos.
Wonderful book.  Lists how you should be preparing each month.  I teach this course, and find this to be a wonderful resource.It was recommended to me by many other teachers.
Really useful as we make the change from "B" to "1". As before, good tips, good summaries, and some good questions.
much better than princeton review. it's practice tests were more accurate for the ap and also provided a lot of solid information. serves as a great aid to an ap physics 1 class
5 Steps to a 5 blends a simplified approach to problem-solving with a confidence building study program for AP Physic's students.

My son who is taking the AP review finds this book very helpful because it's comprehensive and the presentation is highly commended. His class is currently having mock AP exams these days and he says the book has helped him tremendously, even though he hasn't studied the book in its entirety.
This is the best resource I can find on preparing for the new AP exam.  Information is accurate and well thought out.
It is kind of stressful to read through this book. Especially for self-study.

I bought Dan Fullerton's "AP Physics 1 Essentials" which includes many practice problems. However, it is badly organized. Then I bought this book. It did not make me feel better at all. There are only three or four practice problems for each chapter. One third (74 pages) of this book is talking about the so-called "steps". To me, they are useless. To prepare for the AP exam, the most important is to practice more problems. Unfortunately, there is only one practice exam in this book.

I bought this guide for my daughter who was struggling with AP Physics. (I am incapable of helping her....) She likes having a reference, and through her diligence, is performing much better. The book? Whatever helps is good!
A very good guide to the new AP physics content
perfect review material for ap test
Good book.
Good
Look for another AP physics book.
As a student of Mr.Jacobs, I love this book and his class.
Great product
Lots of good stuff to look at in preparation for the new course
Came as described--and promptly.
Text book, what do you expect
